Pre-Game Insights: Virat Kohli mentioned that Shakib Al Hasan is a very experienced bowler who has amazing control, and it's essential to play your best against him.
Paras Mhambrey stated that they have no special strategy to counter Shakib, and whether or not he plays is inconsequential to them.
India are set to face Bangladesh in their next World Cup match, and the numbers are telling, with Indian batters conceding 42 wickets to left-arm spinners since 2022.
Bangladesh have won three of their last four ODIs against India, with their victories occurring in bilateral matches and the recent Asia Cup fixture.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium has traditionally been a batter's paradise.
The weather could be a little cool due to a cyclone warning in the neighbourhood.
Rohit Sharma averages 69.66 against Bangladesh in ODIs he's played against them as captain.
Shakib Al Hasan has three 50+ scores in four World Cup games against India in World Cups.
Others: India's bowling coach Paras Mhambrey praised Jasprit Bumrah's value to the team, stating that he gives them the breakthrough they require in the power plays.
Bangladesh bowling coach Allan Donald considered Virat Kohli as the biggest fish in the opposition camp.
